wikipedia_page.main: Carlos González de Candamo y Rivero  (February 15, 1871 – 16 February 1946) was a Peruvian athlete and diplomat, he was the first Peruvian to compete at a Summer Olympics.

response: *  Some sources consider Carlos de Candamo, a fencer who competed at the 1900 Games, of Peruvian nationality and therefore the first Olympic appearance by Peru. Participation of Peru at the 1900 Games is not recognized by the IOC, so this participation is not counted in Peru's participation total.
Carlos de Candamo competed in two events in 1900, reaching the quarterfinals in the foil and being eliminated in the first round in the épée.
| Foil || 25-34 ||align=left| Carlos de Candamo ||   Advanced by jury ||   To repechage by jury  || Not advanced  by jury ||colspan=2| Did not advance
| Épée || 35-104 ||align=left| Carlos de Candamo || 3rd-6th  in pool M || Did not advance || None held ||colspan=2| Did not advance

Peru's first official appearance at the Olympic Games was at the 1936 Summer Olympics in Berlin. However, prior to the creation of the Peruvian Olympic Committee in 1924, the Peruvian Carlos de Candamo competed in the 1900 Summer Olympics in two fencing events of foil and épée. Peru's first participation in the Winter Olympic Games occurred during the 2010 Winter Olympics.

Peru's 1900 Olympic debut included 1 fencer, Carlos de Candamo, who competed in each of the foil and épée individual amateur events and reached the repechage (18th to 24th place) in the foil. As of the 2016 Games, the nation has yet to win a medal in the sport.
